app.word: Can mass move/delete topics in forums?
Will be able to move topics/questions only between the forums they can create new content within.
Some forums are set up to only show topics/questions to the user that posted them. When this setting is enabled, the moderator will be able to view topics/questions they did not post in those forums.
Can set best answer/solved for questions and topics?
Can recommend posts on a topic?
Can remove post recommendations on a topic?
Can set a future publishing date?
Can view pending publishing items authored by other members?
Users can start topics that other users can reply to. Replies are shown in the order they're posted.
Users can ask questions that other users can post answers to. Answers can then be rated by other users and the highest rated answers are shown first.
Container for other forums. Nothing can be posted directly within them.
Redirects users to another location when clicked on.

When enabled, users who have permission to access the forum will need to provide the password. Users who do not have permission to access the forum will not be prompted for the password. The password applies only to this forum, if this forum has subforums, the password will not be required for them.
Topics posted in a password protected forum will not show in any sidebar, header or footer blocks, and notifications for new topics and posts will not be sent.
The rules will be shown on a separate page with a link added in the forum header
The rules will be shown inline in the forum header
When enabled, all topics from this forum and any child forums will be shown in a single list with a filter box to allow your members to filter out of specific child forums
Combined fluid view cannot be enabled as this forum does not have any sub-forums
If disabled, the user's total number of content items will not increase when a user posts in this forum. You may want to disable this for forums for posting test messages, etc.
The number of times users have clicked on the forum and been redirected, which is shown in the list of forums. This number automatically increases, but you can manually adjust it here.
If provided, this message will be displayed if a user who does not have permission to access this forum tries to access it.
When viewing this forum, the selected theme will be used regardless of the user's preference.
You can control which groups can rate in the Group Settings
Minimum content count to see forum
Users can see topics posted by other users?

Moderators can (where they have permission) see all topics. You can use this setting to create a forum where users can communicate privately with staff.
Topics posted in a forum that doesn't allow others to view topics will not show in any sidebar, header or footer blocks.
Users can see questions asked by other users?
Moderators can (where they have permission) see all questions. You can use this setting to create a private support forum.
Users can see topics posted by other users?
You and any other moderators or leaders of this club will be able to see all topics. You can use this setting to create a forum where users can communicate privately with the club moderators.
Users without read permission can open forum?
If a user does have permission to see the forum but not to read the topics, this setting controls whether or not they can open the forum and see the topic titles.
Users without read permission can open forum?
If a user does have permission to see the forum but not to read the questions, this setting controls whether or not they can open the forum and see the question titles.
If using a closed system, users will have to choose from these tags. If using an open system, tags entered here will show as suggestions.
The priority value in a sitemap file indicates to search engines how important a page is compared to other pages on the site. Sitemap Settings
Questions that have been rated the best within the last 30 days will show under 'Popular Questions' in the forum home.
Answers are ordered with the best rated answers first.
User who asked question can choose the best answer?
The best answer is always displayed above all other answers.

The icon displays next to the forum in the forum list. It will automatically be faded out to indicate if there are no unread topics within the forum.
If none is provided, the default icon will be used.
Only categories can have no parent.
A feature color will be used in various places such as the forum/category title, forum badges and the forum index.
When viewing forums as a grid, your chosen image will appear as the background.
Moderators (and optionally topic starters) can mark posts as the solution.
Allow the topic starter to mark solved?
Optionally allow the topic starter to also mark posts as the solution.
Topics which are Popular Now are highlighted in the list.
New questions are highlighted at the top of the page when viewing a forum.
Questions where a best answer has not been chosen.
Questions which have not received any answers.
Table: A traditional forum index table view
Grid: Display forums as cards in a grid
Fluid: A simpler dynamic listing topics with a forum filter box
Fluid view works best with fewer forums with less complex hierarchies. The fluid view selector will only display up to three levels deep.
Select the views you will allow members to choose from
Do not allow members to choose
Show pinned topics from selected forums at the top of the topic list when fluid mode is used
You must select at least two views for members to choose from

If you have a very large site, it can be beneficial to reduce the size of the database table storing posts. Archiving topics is an alternative to deleting which allows them to still exist and be viewed as normal, but moves them to a separate database table. Archived topics cannot be posted in or edited, and will not show in search results. You can unarchive topics after they've been archived if you change your mind.

Archiving older non-pinned and non-featured topics keeps your community running smoothly. Archived topics cannot be posted in or edited, and will not show in search results. You can unarchive topics after they've been archived if you change your mind.

Archiving older non-pinned and non-featured topics on larger sites helps keep your community running smoothly. Archived topics cannot be posted in or edited, and will not show in search results. When your community reaches a certain size, archiving of older topics will be required.
Archive topics when all of the following conditions are true...
But not when any of the following conditions are true...
If you have already set up archiving and want to change the storage location, you will manually need to move the posts which have already been archived. Contact technical support for assistance.
A database table within the same database as the rest of the site
Number of topics that will be archived with selected rules
Allow this topic to be archived
Unarchiving this topic will exclude it from being archived again in the future. After confirming, it will take about {# [1:minute][?:minutes]} until the topic is actually unarchived.
Some topics that are already archived no longer match your archive settings. Would you like to unarchive them?
Yes, restore topics that do not match the new archive settings
No, keep all currently archived topics as archived
The database must be already created. If you're not sure how to create a database, contact your hosting provider for assistance.
If you're not sure, leave at the default value.
If not provided, the server's default setting will be used. If you're not sure, leave at the default value.
If provided, the archive database table created will be prefixed with the value provided. It is recommended this is left blank.

If disabled, new comments will no longer require moderator approval.

if the topic is not solved and the topic was started
never email the author to ask

Show moderator name alongside moderation events
If disabled, the name of the moderator who performed the action will be hidden from other users who do not have permission to moderate within the forum.
